censusapi 0.7.2
  • Reference
  • Getting started with censusapi
  • Example master list
  • News

Get dataset metadata on all available APIs as a data frame

Source: R/metadata_functions.R
listCensusApis.Rd

Scrapes https://api.census.gov/data.json and returns a dataframe that includes: title, name, vintage (where applicable), url, isTimeseries (binary), temporal (helpful for some time series), description, modified date

listCensusApis()

Examples

apis <- listCensusApis()
head(apis)

#>                                               title   name vintage
#> 457 Annual Economic Surveys: Annual Business Survey  abscb    2017
#> 541 Annual Economic Surveys: Annual Business Survey  abscb    2018
#> 458 Annual Economic Surveys: Annual Business Survey abscbo    2017
#> 542 Annual Economic Surveys: Annual Business Survey abscbo    2018
#> 459 Annual Economic Surveys: Annual Business Survey  abscs    2017
#> 543 Annual Economic Surveys: Annual Business Survey  abscs    2018
#>                                         url isTimeseries     temporal
#> 457  https://api.census.gov/data/2017/abscb           NA unidentified
#> 541  https://api.census.gov/data/2018/abscb           NA unidentified
#> 458 https://api.census.gov/data/2017/abscbo           NA unidentified
#> 542 https://api.census.gov/data/2018/abscbo           NA unidentified
#> 459  https://api.census.gov/data/2017/abscs           NA unidentified
#> 543  https://api.census.gov/data/2018/abscs           NA unidentified
#>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 description
#> 457 The Annual Business Survey (ABS) provides information on selected economic and demographic characteristics for businesses and business owners by sex, ethnicity, race, and veteran status. Further, the survey measures research and development (for microbusinesses), new business topics such as innovation and technology, as well as other business characteristics. The U.S. Census Bureau and the National Center conduct the ABS jointly for Science and Engineering Statistics within the National Science Foundation. The ABS replaces the five-year Survey of Business Owners (SBO) for employer businesses, the Annual Survey of Entrepreneurs (ASE), the Business R&D and Innovation for Microbusinesses survey (BRDI-M), and the innovation section of the Business R&D and Innovation Survey (BRDI-S). https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/abs.html 
#> 541 The Annual Business Survey (ABS) provides information on selected economic and demographic characteristics for businesses and business owners by sex, ethnicity, race, and veteran status. Further, the survey measures research and development (for microbusinesses), new business topics such as innovation and technology, as well as other business characteristics. The U.S. Census Bureau and the National Center conduct the ABS jointly for Science and Engineering Statistics within the National Science Foundation. The ABS replaces the five-year Survey of Business Owners (SBO) for employer businesses, the Annual Survey of Entrepreneurs (ASE), the Business R&D and Innovation for Microbusinesses survey (BRDI-M), and the innovation section of the Business R&D and Innovation Survey (BRDI-S). https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/abs.html
